IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
PHR: Although a wide panel of genetically manipulated mouse strains have made significant contributions in increasing our understanding of the molecular and genetic bases of periodontitis that affects over 46% of the U.S. adult populations (>30y), mouse biological systems don't completely duplicate that of human. This study is intended to develop a humanized mouse model of periodontitis, so that possible pathological effect of human Semaphorin 4D expressed on human osteoclasts in the dysregulated bone remodeling in periodontitis, is evaluated in the physiological context. This emerging technology of “humanized mice”, i.e., immunodeficient mice engrafted with functional human cells and tissues, offers a great opportunity to examine the questions that can't be addressed using human subjects, conventional tissue culture system or animal model.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE  Brain cancer is a leading cause of death and brain metastases represent a highly unmet clinical need. In particular, brain metastases from breast cancer are associated with dismal prognosis. This proposal seeks to elucidate the mechanisms by which breast cancer spreads to the brain, utilizing our in vivo models to evaluate brain tumor tropic genes, novel imaging methods of cellular tracking in the CNS, and ultimately development of a novel stem cell-based therapy for HER2+ brain metastases.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative/ Relevance to Public Health Blockage of the carotid arteries by plaque can cause stroke, particularly in people over 65 years old, and surgery is often done to decrease the chance of stroke when carotid narrowing is found. The goal of this study is to see what activities are most important for older people with carotid artery disease, and how medicine or surgery can help them perform these activities. In this study, we will ask questions about how well older patients with carotid narrowing think, feel, and are able to do what makes them happy before and after surgery to see if surgery improves these things, even though surgery is performed to reduce their risk of stroke.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: The work of a Clinician Scientist, with regards to development of clinical trials, implementation of clinical trials at their institution, and leadership roles within the national cooperative groups, is invaluable to the continued success of NCI-funded clinical cancer research. This award provides salary support and sufficient autonomy such that the Clinician Scientist does not have to solely rely on NCI-funded grants held by others or other institutional sources of support in order to participate in NCI-funded clinical research. Dr. Cathy Eng is an exemplary Clinician Scientist as evidenced by her dedication to the NCI-sponsored clinical trial networks through development and leadership of clinical trials, service in leadership roles, and mentorship.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE  Emerging and re-emerging respiratory viruses are a significant threat to public health and the global economy. While a dysregulated immune response is believed to cause acute lung injury and severe pneumonia following SARS-CoV-2 and other pathogenic human coronavirus infections, the basis for such deleterious host response is not well understood. Here, we will investigate the role of myeloid cell-intrinsic TLR-TRAF6 activation in causing SARS-CoV-2-induced lethal lung disease and define the mechanistic basis for TRAF6-mediated dysregulated immunity.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
PHR: NARRATIVE The Alliance of Genome Resources (the Alliance) is a “knowledge commons” platform for expertly curated model organism data and annotations obtained from multiple model organism databases (MODs) and the Gene Ontology Consortium (GOC). The mission of the Alliance is to advance the utility of diverse model organisms for investigating the genetic and genomic basis of human biology, health, and disease. The primary goals for the Alliance Central outlined in this proposal are to: (1) promote comparative genomics via unified user interfaces and APIs for data types shared by the MODs and GOC, (2) promote sustainability and operational efficiencies of model organism knowledgebases by deploying and adopting shared, modular infrastructure and software, and (3) support multiple avenues for community outreach and engagement.

IC_NAME: OFFICE OF THE DIRECTOR, NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH
PHR: Project Narrative Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) are significant public health concerns in the United States, with growing evidence suggesting that endocrine disrupting chemicals (EDCs) may contribute to their development. However, the molecular mechanisms through which prenatal EDC exposure influences neurodevelopment remain poorly understood. The proposed research aims to examine whether the associations between prenatal EDC exposure and ASD- and ADHD-related behaviors during early childhood are mediated by biomarkers related to two potential mechanisms: inflammatory cytokines and DNA methylation.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Cancer kills the second most people after cardiovascular diseases, and conquering cancer depends on basic and translational research that often need specialized expertise, sophisticated technologies and instrumentation unable to be mastered by individual researchers. I am a highly accomplished research specialist and a long-term technical leader who has made hundreds of genetically engineered mouse models essential for the success of many cancer research programs led by many cancer investigators. With the support of an NCI R50 grant, I will develop new mouse, rat and Nile rat genome-editing methodologies and many novel genetic rodent models for cancer research to help conquering cancer and advance my professional career at the same time.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The Eye Adult Changes in Thought (ACT) study builds on the success of the first funding cycle (>60 publications) and proposes state-of-the-art visual function and retinal imaging data collection while leveraging the parent ACT study’s growth from 2000 to 3000 active participants, with new enrollees specifically targeted to enhance diversity. The investigators expect to recruit >90% of the ACT study for Eye ACT prospective data collection with three non-invasive ophthalmic imaging modalities and analyze these data with next generation machine learning approaches to evaluate associations with cognitive decline and testing visual impairment as a causal mediator in the relationship between eye diseases and Alzheimer’s disease and related dementia (ADRD) (Aim 1). The investigators will leverage extensive neuropathology data for evaluating vascular disease as a potential mechanistic link between eye diseases, ADRD neuropathology and ADRD dementias (Aim 2), and build a novel ophthalmic data curation and sharing platform to address the critical need in the field for large and comprehensive datasets of well characterized individuals to be available for interested researchers anywhere while addressing data privacy concerns through a proof-of-concept federated learning study (Aim 3).

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Urinary tract infections (UTIs) are a major driver for antibiotic prescriptions worldwide, with uropathogenic E. coli (UPEC) accounting for >75% of all UTIs. As a result of increasing antibiotic resistance, last resort antibiotics like fosfomycin have begun to be prescribed more frequently. In this work, I propose to determine how resistance to fosfomycin influences UPEC infection progression and to classify currently uncharacterized routes to fosfomycin resistance relevant to the clinical field.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Adolescent obesity in the United States continues to be an epidemic, disproportionately affecting Hispanic adolescents. This study proposal will result in research findings on 1) the role of etiological factors using a socioecological perspective on Hispanic adolescent obesity, 2) the use of ecological momentary assessment to examine momentary effects of family functioning on obesity risk behaviors, and 3) preliminary evidence used to develop an ecological momentary obesity intervention protocol. The long-term outcome of this research study includes the development of an ecological momentary intervention that has the potential to reduce obesity in Hispanic adolescents.

IC_NAME: Veterans Affairs
PHR: Connecting Veterans to meaningful employment is a goal of VA, which has long recognized the important relationship between work and health by providing vocational rehabilitation to Veterans with disabilities. Many Iraq and Afghanistan war Veterans have experienced polytrauma/traumatic brain injury (PT/TBI) and are unemployed and looking for work. Studies have shown that some individuals with PT/TBI have trouble finding or keeping jobs because of problems with headaches, concentration, memory, planning, and other symptoms resulting from the injury. Supported employment (SE) is an effective program that helps Veterans find work that is meaningful to them, and provides them with unlimited support and job coaching. The Veteran’s SE and treatment teams work together to develop strategies for success in the workplace. This study will provide SE services to Veterans with PT/TBI and measure their employment, health symptoms, and self-esteem over time, and how well the SE and PT/TBI teams work together.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE (HG003345) The HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) is the only organisation worldwide that provides official unique symbols and names for all human genes, and coordinates gene naming across vertebrate species. Standardized gene naming is an essential component of genomics, and hence a key feature of the infrastructure of biomedical research that must be actively maintained and updated. The HGNC's resources accelerate science by providing a common language to discuss genes; as genomic medicine becomes mainstream, the need for this common language becomes ever more vital.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Endothelial inflammation occurs in the setting of severe COVID-19 infection, leading to organ dysfunction and thrombosis. We have recently identified that an increase in a histone methyltransferase, MLL1/Kmt2a, is responsible for altering the adhesive and thrombotic properties of the endothelial cell by enabling gene transcription. In this proposal we will understand the mechanisms that lead to increased MLL1 activity and test new cell targeted therapies to restore endothelial homeostasis.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE In 2022-2023, Midwestern states enacted major policy changes with immediate implications for legal access to pregnancy-related care for millions of people. This study examines the barriers to abortion care faced by pregnant Midwesterners in the wake of these major policy shifts, and the longitudinal impact of those barriers on pregnancy and other physical, mental, and financial health outcomes. Data from this study will be used to communicate the public health impact of restrictions on abortion care, and to inform a health communication outreach intervention to improve healthcare access and reduce maternal morbidity for those in the Midwest.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON ALCOHOL ABUSE AND ALCOHOLISM
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE  Alcohol use among sexual and gender minorities is a significant public health concern, yet individual differences and processes of risk among these communities remain unclear. In this proposal, we aim to identify intersectional, systemic, and minority stress factors driving of alcohol risk in these communities using novel machine learning methods in longitudinal national data preceding, during, and after the coronavirus pandemic. This will identify for whom and why alcohol risk is greatest among these underserved populations, informing specialized strategies for alcohol prevention and responsive public health intervention during future global health crises.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR
PHR: . There are no changes to the original Project Narrative. The adrenal cortex is composed of three zones that include: an outer adrenal zona glomerulosa that produces mineralocorticoids, a middle zona fasciculata that produces glucocorticoids and the inner zona reticularis that produces androgens and androgen precursors. This zonation of the adrenal is established by centripetal ‘streaming’ of the outer subcapsular progenitor cells to the inner zones; and its functionality is maintained by the differential expression of the enzymes required for mineralocorticoid vs. glucocorticoid vs. androgen production. The proposed research will define (1) the factors causing progenitor cell differentiation into steroid-producing glomerulosa cells; and (2) the mechanisms leading to innermost reticularis cell androgen production.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: NARRATIVE NovaSterilis, Inc. intends to develop and commercialize its novel sterilization platform based on supercritical carbon dioxide (scCO2) and powerful sterilant, NovaKill™ for the pharmaceutical market – NovaAPI™. Sterilization of drug substances (or active pharmaceutical ingredients; APIs) and drug products is a challenging application due to the complexities of many drugs and biologics and the minimal compatibility of current sterilization modalities (e.g., steam, radiation, ethylene oxide). This effort will draw form previous research results that support the development of the NovaSterilis platform for sterilization of drug substances and products with the potential for developing a terminal sterilization process for final drug products in vial/syringe format.

IC_NAME: AGENCY FOR HEALTHCARE RESEARCH AND QUALITY
ORG_NAME: UNIV OF NORTH CAROLINA CHAPEL HILL
PHR: Project Narrative In this study will use two national data sources and primary data collection to estimate inequities in, and elicit lived experiences of, financial hardship among LGBTQ+ cancer survivors and caregivers. By understanding financial hardship heterogeneity and modifiable factors, this study goes far beyond simply documenting LGBTQ+ differences and tangibly moves towards equity in health care quality, affordability, and access for LGBTQ+ cancer survivors and caregivers. The findings from this study will inform multi-level interventions and policy that are specific to the LGBTQ+ population—an understudied population at risk of poor economic outcomes.

PROJECT_TITLE: Financial Hardship among LGBTQ+ Cancer Survivors and Caregivers: Prevalence, Determinants, and Access to Care

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
PHR: There are no approved treatments for congenital cognitive impairments in individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). However, our preliminary results indicate that limited postnatal treatment with the hypothalamic peptide oxytocin can effect a life-long rescue of memory functions in the mouse model of Fragile- X Syndrome, the leading inherited cause of ASD. The proposed studies will test if postnatal oxytocin treatment rescues a range of social and episodic memory functions, and normalizes neurobiological processes underlying memory encoding in the Fragile X model mutants, and if these functional changes reflect direct oxytocin action on trophic signaling in the developing hippocampus.

PHR: Project Narrative Sensory perception modulates many aspects of physiology and health, and our previous work in the fruit fly, Drosophila melanogaster, has established that aging is also strongly modulated by sensory systems through mechanisms that are largely unknown. Our studies will use genetic analysis to investigate central control of aging and physiology in Drosophila to illuminate how similar processes may control healthy aging in mammals.

IC_NAME: FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION
ORG_NAME: ASSOCIATION OF FOOD AND DRUG OFFICIALS
PHR: RFA-FD-22-021 AFDO’s System for Agriculture, Food, Health, E-Inspections and Registration (SAFHER): Project Narrative The Association of Food and Drug Officials’ (AFDO) efforts under this cooperative agreement are intended to support the planning, development, implementation, operation, and maintenance of data management system to be utilized by State, Local, Tribal, and Territorial (SLTT) partners in both human and animal food programs. AFDO will build on an already established user community of stakeholders to enhance FDA’s ORA Data Exchange capabilities by utilizing software development methodologies (i.e. Agile) to ensure a long-term sustainable data management system that is easy to use and maintain by state regulatory partners during and after this cooperative agreement. Through effective governance, vendor procurement, and resource management, this project will deliver a national regulatory data repository that will work towards achieving a national Integrated Food Safety System (IFSS) while promoting One Health and supporting domestic mutual reliance initiatives to protect the food supply and advance public health.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
ORG_NAME: UNIV OF NORTH CAROLINA CHAPEL HILL
PHR: Calprotectin is a metal binding, innate immune protein that accumulates at extremely high levels at the site of infection. We discovered that calprotectin has enzymatic activity that leads to the inactivation of -lactam antibiotics, including ampicillin, amoxicillin, and oxacillin. Here, we propose to measure how calprotectin mediated antibiotic inactivation affects antibiotic treatment of infected mice, while also elucidating the molecular mechanism of -lactam inactivation.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR
PHR: Project Narrative: Cardiomyopathies are heart muscle disorders that occur in 1 out of 250 individuals in the general population and are often due to genetic variants that reduce the effective gene “dose” (also referred to as “haploinsufficiency”). However, despite knowledge of the primary genetic causes, prediction of which individuals are at highest risk is currently not possible because additional variants in the genetic code probably “modify” the risk associated with the primary genetic causes. Focusing on genes that are commonly associated with cardiomyopathy, this proposal will find these additional genetic modifiers with the goal that high-risk patients can be more accurately predicted and receive better treatments in the future.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative Sarcopenia represents a highly prevalent, unresolved medical issue in an increasing aging and sedentary population. A pharmacologic therapy for muscle loss does not exist, and current diet/exercise therapeutic approaches are often ineffective and/or unfeasible. Findings from these studies may lead to novel approaches for the treatment of skeletal muscle atrophy.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE: We propose to address a pressing need to improve quality of life of older adults with advanced cancer by studying how their social networks provide needed instrumental and emotional support and guidance that, in turn, facilitate frank conversations about their illness, advance care planning and engagement with palliative care. While prior studies have examined the structure of social networks (i.e., family, friends, clergy, internet contacts, cancer survivors), ours will be the first to assess how networks function to provide support, and the qualities of interpersonal relationships within the network that facilitate (or impede) behaviors linked to improved quality of life at the end of life. We will use innovative quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods to analyze surveys and network maps of 300 older patients with advanced cancer and in-depth interviews with a diverse subset of 70 patients and their social network members to characterize potentially malleable aspects of structure, function, and quality of relationships that can inform future social network interventions.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NURSING RESEARCH
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Secure firearm storage programs are an evidence-based approach to mitigate firearm injury and mortality among all young people in the United States and they are low-cost, scalable, and non-politically divisive. S.A.F.E. Firearm is an evidence-based primary prevention program to promote secure storage of firearms that has been implemented in pediatric primary care within two large health systems in Colorado and Michigan, and there is now an opportunity to implement S.A.F.E. Firearm in community settings, including federally qualified health centers (FQHCs) and look-alike safety net health centers where 1 in 11 Americans currently receive health care. The proposed project will be conducted in collaboration with AllianceChicago and the Illinois Primary Health Care Association and will: (a) systematically adapt the S.A.F.E. Firearm program and implementation approach for FQHCs in collaboration with clinicians, health center leaders, parents, and community members; (b) test the effectiveness and identify mechanisms of the adapted program and implementation strategies for supporting equitable delivery of S.A.F.E. Firearm in Illinois FQHCs; and (c) provide insights for equitable implementation of secure firearm storage programs in lower-resourced settings that can be taken to scale nationally to save lives.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Breast conserving surgery is used as part of the treatment of breast cancer, the leading cancer among women in the US, in which the lumpectomy specimen containing breast cancer is excised with a minimum rim of normal tissue. If the breast cancer close to the specimen edge, referred to as the positive margin, is missed during the surgery, it can lead to a high rate of re-surgery. We develop an X-ray dual-energy cone-beam microCT technology for point-care, intraoperative positive-margin identification, allowing for reduction of re- surgery rate in breast conserving surgery and for tumor cataloguing in breast cancer research and treatment.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE This grant proposal aims to develop novel computational methods and software tools for analyzing pangenomic data. The proposal is divided into five specific aims, which include creating a pangenome mapper supporting long-reads, developing personalized pangenomes, creating a pangenome variant calling and imputation method for unified genome inference, genotyping complex SVs involving protein-coding genes, and developing mature rGFA based variant calling for reporting both SV and small variants within polymorphic sequence. The proposed software tools and methods will enable researchers to analyze pangenomic data more effectively and efficiently, leading to new insights into genetic variation and its role in disease and other biological processes.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Project Narrative Postmortem studies show that there is normative loss of synaptic connections in the prefrontal cortex into adulthood believed to support cognitive development but which has also been implicated in mental illness, which often emerges in adolescence. However, evidence from live humans has not been possible until the recent progress in MRI, including those we have proposed in the original grant. Here, we add gold-standard PET based measures in adults of the original study in order to confirm the characterization of the non-invasive MRI measures of the original study and electroencephalography (EEG) to understand the effects of synapse loss on brain function.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative  Endocrine interactions have been demonstrated as causal and contributory to most common, most notably obesity, type 2 diabetes and resulting cardiovascular complications. The goal of this proposal is to closely bridge computational and experimental methods to systematically dissect mechanisms by which tissues communicate and how these interactions are perturbed in disease settings. Collectively, we will begin with newly developed and unbiased computational approaches which survey population data, validate using high-throughput in vitro assays and evaluate therapeutic potential of new endocrine interactions using mouse models of metabolic disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative: The neutrophil is the most abundant white blood cells and plays critical roles in inflammatory diseases including various heart diseases. Polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs), which include omega-3 fatty acids and are enriched in foods such as fish oil, are known to have beneficial effects on heart health, but how they protect hearts is not well understood. This study will shed lights into how PUFAs help to reduce inflammation pertinent to heart health.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ARTHRITIS AND MUSCULOSKELETAL AND SKIN DISEASES
PHR: There is a clear need for identifying easily measurable biomarkers for diagnosing and monitoring disease  progression in systemic lupus erythematosus, predicting response to therapy and prognosticating long term  outcome in this chronic systemic autoimmune disease. In this study, we will perform extended clinical validation  of selected biomarker proteins in multiple patient cohorts in order to define the potential clinical utility of these  test proteins. The availability of accurate biomarkers to gauge each phase of the disease can significantly  improve patient outcome in lupus.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MIAMI SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE In this study, we will determine differences in neighborhood social and built environment (SBE) exposures over the life course among Hispanic individuals born in and outside the US, will evaluate whether associations between neighborhood SBE and cognitive and MRI outcomes differ by place of birth, and will conduct semi- structured interviews to develop a richer understanding of neighborhood SBEs at various life stages among foreign-born and US-born Hispanic individuals. Limited data are presently available on how neighborhood SBE differ based on place of birth and how they relate to the healthy immigrant effect and impact late life brain health among US Hispanic immigrants. This study targets these scientific gaps to elucidate social/structural causes of Hispanic disparities in ADRD risk that may be targeted via community-level interventions.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: Cognitive and mood disorders occur more commonly in people with HIV than in the general population but the field still does not fully understand why and has no effective therapies for most of those who are affected. This project will take a new approach to understanding how cognition, mood, substance use, and medical characteristics cluster together and will identify new biological mechanisms associated with these conditions. The successful project could lead to new diagnostic tests and therapies for these disorders, which would have substantial public health relevance.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: Project Narrative Early life social isolation and loneliness produce deleterious effects on socioemotional and cognitive development and can increase drug and alcohol usage in adolescent humans and animals. We will assemble a multidisciplinary team with expertise in translational SUD research/addiction, neurocognitive testing, neural signal processing, sleep neurobiology, neurohistology and circadian rhythms to determine how SI and loneliness impact drug seeking and consummatory behavior, cognition and neurocircuit activity and the role that sleep may play in altered cognition and addictive behavior. Our goal is to identify, and develop methods to pursue, promising lines of research that will increase understanding of the effects of early life SI and loneliness on subsequent cognition and addictive behavior.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative Our goal is to validate an age-appropriate and achievable lifestyle modification to proactively protect cognitive health in an aging population. We hypothesize that the cognitive benefits boosted by dietary flavonoids (e.g. from berries) and by physical exertion (movement) are both mediated by the diversity, functionality and composition of gut microbiota, which control delivery of cognition-relevant phenolic metabolites into human circulation. This project will explore the dynamic interplay between physical activity-driven, microbe-mediated flavonoid biotransformation into bioactive phenolic metabolites, and age-related cognitive function.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: NARRATIVE The standard of care treatment for locally advanced cervical cancer is the same for all patients and results in cure only 30-60% of the time. Those who die of the disease are most often young, otherwise healthy women who lose many productive years of life. The overarching goal of this proposal is to improve survival for women with cervical cancer through the first test of a new and shorter treatment paradigm in a clinical trial, and by testing new drug and radiation combinations using a novel animal model of cervical cancer in a manner that will ultimately allow patient-specific selection of treatment approaches in the future.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Individuals with overweight and obesity can experience substantial health benefits from behavioral weight loss treatment, but there are barriers to in-person programs and remote programs are rarely reimbursed by third- party payers. As decisions for insurance coverage for obesity treatment continue to evolve, it is important that reimbursement considerations for remote programs are evidence based and that patients are referred to the type of remote program that is most likely to benefit them. This study represents a critical first step towards informing those decisions, by comparing remote weight loss programs which vary in delivery format and level of support, and seeking to develop algorithms to predict for whom each treatment should be recommended.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE: Improving the quality of care for older adults with melanoma is public health priority because 1) it affects a large and growing number of people, 2) it can reduce ineffective or unwanted care, 3) it can maximize goal- concordant effective care. This project aims to address these priorities by improving the quality of evidence and adapting a shared decision-making framework designed to improve communication between providers and patients. Given trends in the incidence of melanoma in older adults, the proposed work in this study could impact approximately 40,000 older Americans annually who develop melanoma.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Fifty percent of all blindness is due to retinal degenerative diseases, which are a group of conditions caused by damage to light sensing neurons of the eye. We have identified a cell type in the retina, called microglia, that protects the retina from damage associated with these diseases. This project is aimed at understanding the protective mechanisms, which in turn will help to identify new potential targets for treatment of these disease.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON ALCOHOL ABUSE AND ALCOHOLISM
PHR: Narrative Unhealthy alcohol use among people with HIV (PWH) can interrupt engagement in HIV care, adherence to antiretroviral therapy, and viral suppression. As a result, alcohol use is a barrier to HIV elimination. We are testing whether an intervention that focuses on alcohol reduction integrated into HIV care in Pune, India can clinical outcomes and overall health.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Cannabis use during adolescence co-occurs with depression and suicidal ideation at greater than expected rates. However, little is known about the impact of acute cannabis use and withdrawal on depression and suicidal ideation, particularly among high-risk adolescents. This study seeks to disentangle the time-varying relationships between acute cannabis use and withdrawal on proximal depression and suicide risk using ecological momentary assessment within the context of a randomized controlled design in order to guide the development of scalable and individualized interventions aimed to reduce depression and suicide risk among adolescents.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The Health Equity Research Hub at the University of Maryland Baltimore (UMB) will provide localized technical assistance and scientific support for assigned CHESIs in addition to partnership support, research capacity-building, and training. Our vision and proposed activities align with modeling and teaching our authentic community-academic partnership (CAP) approach in addition to providing technical and scientific support. Our overarching goal is to not only serve as a catalyst for CHESIs to complete their ComPASS projects in a rigorously scientific manner but to achieve their goals in a manner that demonstrates how communities of patients and researchers can collaborate to address social determinants of health (SDOH) and advance health equity in neighborhoods and society at large.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The world population is growing older yet living to age 90 is still considered to be exceptional. In this project, we will assess whether modifiable factors in older adults impact their likelihood of living to age 90. The project will generate critical evidence targeted towards older adults on the role of modifiable factors on longevity to promote health span and to re-orient medical practice to focusing on holistic prevention efforts.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON ALCOHOL ABUSE AND ALCOHOLISM
PHR: Project Narrative Binge alcohol consumption poses a major public health burden in the U.S., leading to increased rates of mortality and other pathophysiologies, such as anxiety and depression. The proposed work will examine how repeated cycles of binge-like alcohol drinking dysregulate serotonin signaling in a discrete neural circuit, which may drive future binge alcohol intake and contribute to negative health outcomes. This may lead to the identification of more effective therapeutic strategies for the treatment of alcohol use disorder.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
ORG_NAME: STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AT ALBANY
PHR: Project Narrative The proposed research addresses a relevant public health issue, as proper development of the neurons that secrete Gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH-1) is essential for sexual development and function throughout life. In this project, we will elucidate molecular mechanisms controlling the development of olfactory support cells and the formation of the terminal nerve, processes essential for supporting the migration of GnRH-1-expressing neurons from the nasal area to the brain, a key event in establishing hormonal regulation. The proposed research is relevant to the mission of NICDH/NIH and will provide essential information needed for diagnosing and treating hypogonadotropic hypogonadism in humans.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON ALCOHOL ABUSE AND ALCOHOLISM
PHR: Project Narrative This research will support the development of a fully immersive Virtual Reality (VR) experience that can be used in interventions inspired by motivational interviewing to help develop a personal and vivid sense of discrepancy between users’ desired behavior and current levels of drinking. The proposed research will first develop the VR experience through several cycles of user-centered design research with hazardous drinking, young adult users (Phase 1), and then pilot test whether young adults who received a VR-enhanced brief motivational intervention (BMI) drink less and experience fewer alcohol-related problems over six months than those receiving a standard BMI (Phase 2). We will also explore clinic-level barriers to VR implementation among directors of college and community addiction counseling clinics (Phase 3).

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MIAMI SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Tele-Harm Reduction seeks to engage people who inject drugs (PWID) into HIV care by bringing healthcare out of the traditional healthcare system and leveraging syringe services programs as trusted venues to deliver telehealth-enhanced access to antiretrovirals, medications for opioid use disorder, and hepatitis C cure. We urgently need a robust evidence base to prove that Tele-Harm Reduction can help us End the HIV Epidemic in PWID and save lives. We seek to set the foundation to build a new standard of care to treat HIV among PWID.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Voice disorders are common in older adults and can have significant impacts on social interaction. This proposal investigates the impact of voice impairment in older adults on social interaction, loneliness, social disconnectedness, and depression. A series of questionnaires, voice assessments, and interviews will be performed to improve our understanding of how voice disorders affect older adults and how treatment of voice impairment with voice therapy may improve quality of life.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE STATEMENT: Post Operative Delirium (POD) is notorious for its association with poor outcomes including post-operative cognitive decline (POCD) and high mortality, and exposes elderly patients to a greater risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease, and Alzheimer’s disease patients are more likely to develop POD. The discovery of epigenetics biomarkers whereby those at high risk for POD can be identified would lead to optimized patient care, improved patient outcomes, and more efficient allocation of hospital resources. As such, the proposed research investigating the role of epigenetics in POD and POCD is expected to provide important and new information that can be used to help guide the prevention of POD, POCD, and dementia and is likely to facilitate the development of treatments for elderly patients who experience POD.

The outcomes of our proposed studies have the potential to furnish a compelling justification for the utilization of protein arginine methyltransferase inhibitors in oncology.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON ALCOHOL ABUSE AND ALCOHOLISM
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The proposed training program “Alcohol Prevention Research on Violence, Equity, and Novel Techniques (A- PREVENT)” T32 Training Program will equip a diverse cohort of new alcohol prevention researchers with the methodological acumen capable of transformative advances in health equity, and formulating solutions that are both pragmatic and pioneering in addressing health disparities. Supported by 20 faculty mentors across 2 departments, the A-PREVENT T32 Training Program will provide advanced research training in alcohol and violence prevention with a focus on: 1) health equity; 2) designing and implementing multi-level interventions; 3) innovative methodological and statistical approaches to assess efficacy across multiple levels of the social- ecological model and 4) learning to critically apply principles of the ethical and responsible conduct of research. This innovative training program will not only diversify the biomedical research workforce with our trainees from diverse backgrounds, but also prepare them to develop and evaluate multi-level preventive interventions that address health disparities in alcohol and violence.
PROJECT_TERMS: alcohol prevention;Equity;novel;Prevention Research;Training Programs;Training Technics;Violence

IC_NAME: AGENCY FOR HEALTHCARE RESEARCH AND QUALITY
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists (CRNAs) are the sole anesthesia providers in 80% of rural counties in the United States. However, CRNA burnout is as high as 72%, yielding an increased intention to leave one’s primary position. This will be the first research project to examine organizational factors impacting CRNA burnout and turnover and to identify interventions aimed at sustaining the supply of high-quality surgical and anesthesia care providers in rural populations.
PROJECT_TERMS: NA
PROJECT_TITLE: Anesthesia Care Delivery in Rural America: The Impact of Organizational Climate on Burnout, Job Satisfaction, and Intention to Leave among Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR ADVANCING TRANSLATIONAL SCIENCES
PHR: Public Health Relevance. Combined D/L-2-HydroxyGlutaric Aciduria (D/L-2HGA) is considered a rare yet very severe systemic disease that leads to death within the first months of life and for which there is no therapy. Our data identify novel pathways and mechanisms involved in this disease that enlighten nodes of therapeutic attack for the treatment of this devastating disorder.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative The UC Berkeley Training Health Equity ScholaRs in InnoVation, PrEvention, and Social Impact (UCB-THRIVES) T32 Fellowship Program aims to equip emerging health equity scholars with the structural competency and methodological expertise essential for developing and evaluating multi-level, preventive interventions to address health inequities in collaboration with marginalized communities. The program will welcome 3 pre-doctoral students each year who receive comprehensive didactic training and immerse research experiences in health equity, multi-level preventive interventions, and rigorous methodological and statistical approaches. In addition to these foundational areas, three crucial cross-cutting themes will underpin the UCB- THRIVES T32 Program and be pivotal in driving sustainable progress in health equity: 1) community engagement, 2) anti-racism, and 3) social impact.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL EYE INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative The elevated eye pressure in glaucoma is a result of increased resistance to the outflow of the aqueous humor into the lumen of Schlemm’s Canal. The extent of outflow resistance is associated with the cytoskeletal mediated stiffness of Schlemm’s Canal endothelial cells as these cells have to substantially deform to create the openings required to drain aqueous humor into the canal. I will determine how a major cytoskeletal system in these cells, namely vimentin intermediate filament cytoskeleton, contributes to the mechanics required to form the necessary openings, and thus generation of outflow resistance.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: Project Narrative Epidemiological studies clearly show that advanced age is the most important risk factor for cardiovascular disease, but we have an incomplete understanding of how aging promotes cardiovascular disease progression. The accumulation of somatic DNA mutations over time has recently been demonstrated to be a hallmark of aging in many human cell types. The overarching goal of this proposal is to define the extent of somatic mutations in aging human cardiomyocytes, provide an understanding of the mutational processes acting on aging human cardiomyocytes, and explore the link between somatic mutational burden and cardiovascular pathologies, for developing new strategies to treat millions of adults with heart disease associated with aging.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DIABETES AND DIGESTIVE AND KIDNEY DISEASES
PHR: Medicaid and health systems are investing billions of dollars in programs to address health-related social needs, such as food and housing insecurity, but the effectiveness of these programs on health and medical spending are unknown. The overall objective of this research is to extend and expand on the research team’s current evaluation of a Massachusetts Medicaid food and housing insecurity program (i.e., Flexible Services) funded by a Section 1115 waiver to determine the program’s impact on health-related social needs, health, and health care use and spending. Rigorous evaluation of this ongoing natural experiment will provide essential data to guide other states and health systems and inform national policy decisions.

PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE This project proposes to conduct a study of the functional, neural, and molecular impacts of deprescription of anticholinergic medications in mid- to late-life patients with schizophrenia. The information gathered through this project is of considerable public health significance in that it is expected to yield new insights on how to improve outcomes in the later phases of schizophrenia, identify novel neural and molecular treatment targets to promote long-term recovery, and ultimately reduce the significant public health burden of this disabling psychiatric condition.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON ALCOHOL ABUSE AND ALCOHOLISM
PHR: DIVERSITY SUPPLEMENT – PROJECT NARRATIVE Alcohol use disorder is a heterogeneous disorder with different clinical presentations making the disorder difficult to treat. The aims of this diversity supplement are to explain heterogeneity in alcohol use disorder by leveraging deep behavioral phenotyping to derive neurofunctional domains relevant to addiction, and test these domains on translational alcohol-related endpoints in the human laboratory. The candidate will train in translational science in the field of addiction and professional development to prepare him for an independent research career.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The ComPASS Health Equity Research Hub at Yale is a multidisciplinary collaborative of community-engaged researchers that demonstrates the value of integrating diverse perspectives into health equity solutions. Using partnered academic-community teams, the Hub assesses assets and needs, and then tailors and evaluates training and capacity building in research methods, data management, community engagement, and health equity for community-led health equity structural interventions (CHESIs) focused on food/nutrition security, intergenerational family interventions, poverty-reduction, cultural resilience, and participatory research and implementation approaches. Our collaboration long-term goa l is to advance the science of community engagement in with other researchers committed to sustainable health equity.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Project Narrative  Experiments to devise new methods to synthesize cyclic peroxides will enable new approaches to prepare this family of potential drugs and explore how they are active as anti-cancer agents. Studies of the reactions involved in organic synthesis and carbohydrate chemistry will help medicinal chemists use such reactions to make biologically active compounds with greater control of three-dimensional structure. These studies are relevant to human health because they could lead to new ways of making medicines.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The My Own Health Report (MOHR) intervention is already proven to improve multiple cancer risk factors, including insufficient physical activity and fruit/vegetable intake, as compared to usual care in a randomized trial. This trial will test the comparative impact of the MOHR intervention with two distinct implementation strategy bundles alone or in combination on multi-level outcomes relevant to patients and clinics, including cancer risk effectiveness outcomes, implementation outcomes (including equitable patient reach), and practice value outcomes, such as patient experience and costs. Overall, we expect this work to narrow disparities for multiple cancer risks, and to support scaling out the most cost-effective strategy to improve multiple cancer risks and unmet social needs in other rural primary care clinics.

ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR
PHR: Project narrative H3K27M DIPGs in children carry a dismal prognosis and have no effective treatments. The imipridone ONC201 shows great promise in early clinical studies. Our goal is to unravel molecular mechanisms that drive response and resistance to ONC201 treatment to facilitate therapeutic development for these deadly cancers.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DEAFNESS AND OTHER COMMUNICATION DISORDERS
PHR: Project Narrative - Health relevance The grant proposes to test new treatments for complex sentence knowledge and use, for which there is little in the way of effective intervention. The grant will directly test the efficacy of two approaches to language treatment (explicit training of language rules vs. implicit learning of syntactic structures) and will assess different models of the causal relationships among cognitive factors and treatment outcomes.

IC_NAME: EUNICE KENNEDY SHRIVER NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF CHILD HEALTH & HUMAN DEVELOPMENT
ORG_NAME: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE One in six people in the United States have infertility, which is treated most effectively with in vitro fertilization (IVF), but health insurance has historically excluded coverage for IVF. Recently, employers have begun adding IVF as a covered benefit for their employees, but, because these new IVF benefits lack a rigorous evidence base, the new benefits can create more harm than good by incentivizing risky, “one-shot” embryo transfer decisions that lead to high-risk twin, triplet, and higher-order multiple births. The proposed research is relevant to public health because 1) it addresses unanswered questions about which IVF benefit designs are most likely to facilitate singleton births, thus improving maternal and infant health, and 2) the results will provide employers and policymakers with the evidence-based guidance they need to create safer insurance coverage for IVF.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: FDA guidelines stipulate that all new drugs be tested for dangerous side-effects on the heart as part of preclinical research; however, the current tests are poorly predictive of both dangerous and safe drugs leading to unwarranted attrition and dangerous drugs reaching clinic. Human cardiomyocytes derived from donor tissue (iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes) are widely considered to hold great promise for clinical trial in a dish studies of drug cardiotoxicity. This STTR proposal is to commercialize a high throughput platform to accurately identify drug candidates that have cardiac side effects, in particular adding the ability to detect the type of primary heart cell damage common with anti-cancer drugs in a fully automated (high throughput) robotic assay for the first time, to improve the efficiency of preclinical research and the safety of human clinical trials, which will also likely have the added benefit of reducing animal research.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Although immigrants represent a growing, and aging, share of the US population, the state of the science on Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias (ADRD in this population is limited. Research, to date, has not incorporated a life-course approach to study how factors acting early in life, including early in the migration process, accumulate, and/or interact with later life factors to influence biological aging. In this project, researchers leverage comprehensive, longitudinal data from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA) and its associated ancillary studies, MESA Neighborhood and MESA MIND, to identify unique life-course acculturation patterns, based on both individual- and neighborhood-level longitudinal data, and evaluate associations with cognition, AD/ADRD biomarkers, and dementia in a population-based sample of diverse, older adults in the US.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ARTHRITIS AND MUSCULOSKELETAL AND SKIN DISEASES
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The proposed research is expected to develop a new microphysiological ‘joint-on-chip’ system with structural biomimicry and minimal essential functionality. We will conduct studies to validate the system, and position ourselves for the mechanistic study of arthritic diseases and rapid testing of candidate treatments. The technology will enable future studies of senescence, inflammation, nociception, and metabolism, and support expansion to other tissues and cells in the joint organ.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: Twenty percent (20%) of the US adult population have contact with the criminal legal system and people with overdose and substance use disorder risk behaviors are overrepresented in the criminal legal system. Engaging and reaching diverse constituents can improve the uptake of evidence-based quality prevention and treatment services. Targeting people with criminal legal system involvement will improve the health and well-being of individuals, families, and communities.
